fdd:FDD.titleName: DSDIFF, Direct Stream Digital Interchange File Format, Version 1.5

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: Direct Stream Digital Interchange File Format, DSDIFF, Version 1.5
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description:
Format for the storage or exchange of one-bit delta sigma modulated audio, often called Direct Stream Digital, or for the losslessly compressed version called Direct Stream Transfer (DST).
As of 2006, delta sigma modulation is almost exclusively disseminated to endusers on the tangible media format called Super Audio CDs (SACDs), developed by SONY in association with Philips. The DSDIFF_1_5 file format is used by music producers to store DSD content or to deliver it "to the label" for reproduction on SACDs.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Format Description for DSDIFF - Format for the storage or exchange of one-bit delta sigma modulated audio, often called Direct Stream Digital, or for the losslessly compressed version called Direct Stream Transfer (DST).

fdd:relationship.fdd:comment: DST, Direct Stream Transfer format for lossless encoded DSD audio, not documented at this Web site
Marker information, in what is called a Time File, used to support certain editorial or production workflows, not documented at this Web site

fdd:localUse.fdd:experience: The Library of Congress includes a small number of Direct Stream Digital files, especially in the Motion Picture, Broadcasting, and Recorded Sound Division.
fdd:localUse.fdd:preference: The Library of Congress Recommended Formats Statement (RFS) includes DSD as a preferred format for audio on tangible media. The RFS does not specify a version of DSD.

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:disclosure: Developed by Royal Philips Electronics of the Netherlands, now overseen by Sonic Studio LLC.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:documentation: Direct Stream Digital Interchange File Format, DSDIFF, Version 1.5 (2004) and Recommended Usage of DSDIFF Version 1.5.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:transparency: Transparent wrapper. DSD bitstream is relatively transparent; DST is likely to be less so.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:selfDocumentation:
See IFF.
Accessibility Features
There are no specific attributes to support accessibility but the Comments chunk could potentially store transcription or caption data, assigned along a timeline through timestamps, in the Reserved section. But this may not be practical in reality. Comments welcome.
In common practice, typically sound content is supported by external caption and subtitle formats such as WebVTT. See W3C's Making Audio and Video Media AccessibleÂ for more general information about accessible sound and moving image media.

fdd:soundQF.fdd:normalSound: Details unknown; this is a very specialized format for professional producers.
fdd:soundQF.fdd:channels: DSDIFF_1_5 files can be structured for 2 channels or for "5- or 6-channels" (presumably for 5.1 mixes). SACDs may contain a 2-channel stereo mix, a surround mix (usually the 5.1 layout), other mixes, or even multiple mmix versions.
fdd:soundQF.fdd:beyondSound: Not fully investigated. DSDIFF_1_5 files can be divided into ten Division Files to overcome size limits imposed by some operating systems.

fdd:filenameExtension.fdd:note: For a DSDIFF_1_5 Time File; see Recommended Usage, p. 18
For a DSDIFF_1_5 Division File, not to exceed ten in number; see Recommended Usage, p. 16

fdd:values.fdd:note: Wikidata has no corresponding entry as of April 2024.

fdd:urlReference.tag: Direct Stream Digital Interchange File Format, DSDIFF, Version 1.5 (2004)
Recommended Usage of DSDIFF version 1.5, Version 1 (2004)
Support KnowledgeBase from Sonic Studio: DSD and SACD products
fdd:urlReference.comment: Sonic Studio was responsible for development of DSD and SACD, having acquired the complete portfolio of products and services from the ProTECH subsidiary of Philips. However, Sonic Studio no longer seems to be supporting this older knowledgebase or separate DSD products. This link is to a 2009 snapshot of the resources via Internet Archive.
Information in PRONOM from UK National Archives about Direct Stream Digital Interchange File Format. PUID: fmt/1818.
